h:head.h:title: IMCI Protocol

select1.label: SORRY: this system only covers IMCI. Select the complaint then treat normally

trigger.label: ALERT: This child has a serious problem. Complete assement quickly and refer urgently!

select1.label: ASK: Just to check, does the child have a cough?
ASK: Just to check, does the child have any diarrhea?
ASK: Just to check, does the child have any ear problems?
ASK: What kind of visit is this?

trigger.label: SORRY: this system is not yet suitable for follow-up visits. Please use standard procedures.

select1.label: ASK: Can you take the child's temperature?

item.label: Yes, I will use a thermometer
No, but child feels hot or has had fever

input.label: ASK: What is the child's age (in years or months)

select1.label: Was the age in years or months?

trigger.label: SORRY: this system is not yet suitable for children under two months

select1.label: SORRY: IMCI is meant for children 5-years-old or less. Do you want to continue anyway?
ASK: What sex is the child?

input.label: ASK: What is the child's weight in kg (skip if unknown)

select1.label: SORRY: IMCI is meant for children under 19 kgs. Correct dosings may not be available. Do you want to continue anyway?
ASK: How long has child had cough/difficulty breathing?
ASK: Can you measure the breathing rate?

item.label: Yes, I will count number of breaths per minute
No, but breathing rate is normal
No, but breathing rate is fast

input.label: DO: What is the breathing rate in breaths per minute?

select1.label: LOOK: Is the chest indrawing?
LISTEN: Is there stridor?
CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for severe pneumonia or very severe disease
CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for pneumonia
CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for persistent cough or cold, but no pneumonia
CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for cough or cold, but no pneumonia
PLEASE: You have disagreed; select the correct classification
ASK: How long has the child had diarrhea?
ASK: Is there blood in the stool?

trigger.label: DO: Give the child fluid

select1.label: LOOK: How is the child drinking?

item.label: Not able to drink or drinking poorly

select1.label: EXAMINE: Does the child have sunken eyes?
LOOK: Pinch the child's skin

item.label: Skin goes back very slowly (more than 2 seconds)

select1.label: LOOK: Is the child restless and irritable?
CLASSIFY: Child should for dysentery

trigger.label: You have disagreed; new classification is 'Child should for dysentery'

select1.label: CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for with
PLEASE: You have disagreed; select the correct classification

item.label: Severe persistent diarrhea with some dehydration
Severe persistent diarrhea with severe dehydration

select1.label: ASK: How long has the child had fever?
ASK: Has the fever been present every day?
ASK: Has the child had measles within the last 3 months?
LOOK: Does the child have a stiff neck?
EXAMINE: Does the child have a runny nose?
EXAMINE: Does the child have signs of measles? (generalized rash and cough, runny nose, or red eyes)
LOOK: Does the child have mouth ulcers?
LOOK: Are the mouth ulcers deep or extensive?
ASK: Is pus draining from the eye?
EXAMINE: Does child have clouding of the cornea?
CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for severe febrile disease
CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for malaria
CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for fever, but malaria unlikely
PLEASE: You have disagreed; select the correct classification
ASK: Is there ear pain?
ASK: Is there ear discharge?
ASK: How long has there been discharge?
LOOK: Is pus draining from the ear?
FEEL: Is there tenderness or swelling behind the ear?
CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for mastoiditis
CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for an acute ear infection
CLASSIFY: Child should be treated for chronic ear problems
CLASSIFY: Child has no serious ear problem
PLEASE: You have disagreed; select the correct classification
Does child have any other severe classification?
ASK: Is the child breastfeeding?
ASK: Does the child take other food/fluids?

trigger.label: ADVISE: Add other foods/fluids to the child's diet

select1.label: ASK: Did feeding for the child change during illness?

trigger.label: ADVISE: Ensure that the child continues to feed during illness

select1.label: ASK: Does the child have any other problems?

trigger.label: DO: Treat the child's other problems

select1.label: Which form of quinine would you like to use for the severe malaria?
GIVE: of for

trigger.label: DO: Give correct dose and tell observer

select1.label: Which antibiotic would you like to use for the pneumonia?
ASK: Has child ever had a bad reaction to SP?

trigger.label: SORRY: Do not use Cotrimoxazole if child has had a bad reaction to SP

select1.label: Which antibiotic would you like to use for the pneumonia?

trigger.label: DO: Choose appropriate drug

select1.label: Which amoxycillin form would you like to use?
Which cotrimoxazole form would you like to use?
GIVE: of for

trigger.label: DO: Give correct dose and tell observer
An antibiotic has already been given for ; there is no need to give an additional antibiotic for cholera

select1.label: Which antibiotic would you like to use for the cholera?
ASK: Has child ever had a bad reaction to SP?

trigger.label: SORRY: Do not use Cotrimoxazole if child has had a bad reaction to SP

select1.label: Which antibiotic would you like to use for the cholera?

trigger.label: DO: Choose appropriate drug

select1.label: Which cotrimoxazole form would you like to use?
GIVE: of for

trigger.label: DO: Give correct dose and tell observer
An antibiotic has already been given for ; there is no need to give an additional antibiotic for dysentery

select1.label: Which antibiotic would you like to use for the dysentery?
ASK: Has child ever had a bad reaction to SP?

trigger.label: SORRY: Do not use Cotrimoxazole if child has had a bad reaction to SP

select1.label: Which antibiotic would you like to use for the dysentery?

trigger.label: DO: Choose appropriate drug

select1.label: Which cotrimoxazole form would you like to use?
GIVE: of for

trigger.label: DO: Give correct dose and tell observer
An antibiotic has already been given for ; there is no need to give an additional antibiotic for the ear problem

select1.label: Which antibiotic would you like to use for the ear problem?
ASK: Has child ever had a bad reaction to SP?

trigger.label: SORRY: Do not use Cotrimoxazole if child has had a bad reaction to SP

select1.label: Which antibiotic would you like to use for the ear problem?

trigger.label: DO: Choose appropriate drug

select1.label: Which amoxycillin form would you like to use?
Which cotrimoxazole form would you like to use?
GIVE: of for

trigger.label: DO: Give correct dose and tell observer
An antibiotic has already been given for ; there is no need to give an additional antibiotic for the malaria

select1.label: Which antibiotic would you like to use for the malaria?
ASK: Has child ever had a bad reaction to SP?

trigger.label: SORRY: Do not use Cotrimoxazole if child has had a bad reaction to SP

select1.label: Which antibiotic would you like to use for the malaria?

trigger.label: DO: Choose appropriate drug

select1.label: Which amoxycillin form would you like to use?
Which cotrimoxazole form would you like to use?
GIVE: of for

trigger.label: DO: Give correct dose and tell observer

select1.label: DO: Explain how to give the treatment. Give the first treatment. Does the mother understand?

trigger.label: DO: Treat from the IMCI chart to avoid low blood sugar

select1.label: Which paracetamol form would you like to use?

trigger.label: DO: Choose appropriate painkiller

select1.label: GIVE: of

trigger.label: DO: Give correct dose and tell observer
